com.wiris.quizzes.api

Interface Question

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    public interface Question
extends Serializable
    The data defining a question. It is defined by the question author and it is completely independent of the concrete instances of that question. Concretely, it contains the following properties:
    • The question CalcMe session.
    • A translation origin for rendering and clipping coordinates
    • A set of slots, which represent a slot for the student to enter an answer. Each Slot contains:
      • A syntax assertion that specifies the expected syntax of the student's answer being entered into that Slot.
      • The initial content that will be set to that slot's AnswerField.
      • A set of AuthorAnswer, which represent evaluation criteria for the student's answer to be graded against. Each AuthorAnswer contains:
        • A correct answer value that will be compared to the student's answer (AuthorAnswer.getValue()).
        • A Comparison assertion that specifies the type of comparison the will be performed between the student's answer and the correct answer.
        • A (possibly empty) set of Validation assertions that the student's answer has to fulfill in order to be correct.
        • The weight of that AuthorAnswer (that is, the grade that students will obtain if their answer is graded as correct according to the criteria contained in that AuthorAnswer).
      • Optional local data that can override the general local data options set for the question.
    • Some local data (not to be sent to web service).
    See Also:
    Slot, AuthorAnswer

        serialize

    • Method Detail

      • getSlots

        Slot[] getSlots()
        Gets the array of slots of this question.
        Returns:
        The array of slots of this question. It is a shallow copy of the actual implementation array, meaning that the array object itself is new but that its components are the actual implementation objects.
        Since:
        4.0.0.

      • addNewSlot

        Slot addNewSlot()
        Adds a new slot to this question.
        Returns:
        The slot object added to this question.
        Since:
        4.0.0.

      • removeSlot

        void removeSlot(Slot slot)
        Removes a slot from this question.
        Parameters:
        slot - The slot to be removed.
        Since:
        4.0.0

      • setAnswerFieldType

        void setAnswerFieldType(AnswerFieldType type)
        Set the type of input field that will be used for the student answer. Chooses are between an embedded editor, an editor in a popup, a graphical editor or a plain text field. This is part of local data.
        See Also:
        AnswerFieldType

      • getAnswerFieldType

        AnswerFieldType getAnswerFieldType()
        Get the type of input field that will be used for the student answer. Choices are between an embedded math editor, an embedded graphical editor, a math editor in a popup or a plain text field. This is part of local data.
        See Also:
        AnswerFieldType

      • setAlgorithm

        void setAlgorithm(java.lang.String session)
        Set the algorithm that generates this question.
        Parameters:
        session - The XML Wiris cas session with the defined algorithm. Note that if the session has a library, only the code inside the library will be executed.

      • getAlgorithm

        java.lang.String getAlgorithm()
        Get the algorithm that generates this question.
        Returns:
        The Wiris Cas XML session as String or null if the algorithm has not been set or has been set to an empty session.

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(PropertyName name,
               java.lang.String value)
        Set a question property. Question properties define the question behavior at the integration level, but they are not sent to the service.
        Parameters:
        name - The property name, from PropertyName.
        value - The property value.
        Since:
        3.50
        See Also:
        getProperty(PropertyName)

      • getProperty

        java.lang.String getProperty(PropertyName name)
        Get a question property. Question properties define the question behavior at the integration level, but they are not sent to the service.
        Parameters:
        name - The property name, from PropertyName.
        Since:
        3.50
        See Also:
        setProperty(PropertyName, String)

      • getStudentQuestion

        Question getStudentQuestion()
        Creates a new Question only with the data needed to properly render the student's answer page. In particular, it hides all sensible information that would give some information to the student. The result of this method is not intended to be stored but outputted to html. Note that while the object returned is new, it need not to be a full in-depth copy so the contained objects may be shared with this Question.
        Returns:
        The new Question instance ready to be serialized in the student answer HTML page.

      • setCorrectAnswer

        @Deprecated
void setCorrectAnswer(int index,
                               java.lang.String answer)
        Deprecated. Use AuthorAnswer.setValue(String) instead.
        Sets a teacher's question answer.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the teacher answer starting from 0. Most questions have only one single correct answer so the index will be 0.
        answer - The MathML or plain text with the teacher's answer to the question.

      • getCorrectAnswer

        @Deprecated
java.lang.String getCorrectAnswer(int index)
        Deprecated. Use AuthorAnswer.getValue() instead.
        Get a teacher's question answer
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the teacher's answer within this question starting from 0.
        Returns:
        The index-th teacher's answer string.

      • getCorrectAnswersLength

        @Deprecated
int getCorrectAnswersLength()
        Deprecated. Use the arrays getSlots() and Slot.getAuthorAnswers() instead.
        Get the length of the vector of correct answers.

      • addAssertion

        @Deprecated
void addAssertion(java.lang.String name,
                           int correctAnswer,
                           int studentAnswer,
                           java.lang.String[] parameters)
        Deprecated. Use Slot.setSyntax(SyntaxName), AuthorAnswer.setComparison(ComparisonName) or AuthorAnswer.addNewValidation(ValidationName) instead.
        Add a new assertion check to this question.
        Parameters:
        name - The assertion name. Use the constants defined in Assertions class.
        correctAnswer - The correct answer index, starting from 0. If there is only one correct answer set it to 0.
        studentAnswer - The student answer index, starting from 0. If there is only one student answer set it to 0.
        parameters - A String array of ordered parameter values. If set to null the parameters will have its default value. See http://www.wiris.net/demo/quizzes/assertion.xml for a specification of every assertion.

      • setOption

        @Deprecated
void setOption(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String value)
        Deprecated. Use {setProperty(PropertyName, String)} instead.
        Set a question option. The options are the same and have the same names as in the protocol specification of Wiris Quizzes service.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the option. See the option constants in QuizzesConstants for a list and description of all available options.
        value - The value of the option. If set to null the option will be removed from the question.
